Stem: Erect, narrow, drooping more with age.
Leaves: Rough, flat, blades 10-25 cm long, with some hairs. With prominent membrane where they join the stem.
Flowers: Compacted in head which is erect initially but begins to droop with age.
FruitSeeds: Overlapping, rigid and rough, with very long and rough awns 35-60 mm long.
DistinguishingFeatures: Virtually impossible to distinguish from Rigid brome (*Bromus rigidus*). Would need expert advice.

Photos.Caption: Awns on seeds are very long
